page.title: 03National Park Depot,Exford
page.content: Ten men work here and their jobs are all connected with maintaining and creating walks in the National Park. Two men are carpenters producing gates,signs and bridges,one is a mechanic and looks after agricultural vehicles and machines used by the forestry and footpath gangs. These gangs go out each day and do all kinds of things like wall building,cutting grass,tree felling and reinforcing river banks. The depot has been in Exford for 9 years, and the men cover the whole of the National Park. They keep a store of timber, which they felled, and the yard is full of material and equipment they need. Inside the hut is the mechanics and carpenters workshop foremans office and tool store.
